senselogic.sitevision.api.i18n

Interface Currency


  • public interface Currency
    Representation of a currency.

    This interface is conceptually equivalent with the java.util.Currency class.

    An instance of the Sitevision class implementing this interface is obtained via CurrencyFactory.

    Since:
    Sitevision 6.1
    Author:
    Magnus LÃ¶vgren

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getCurrencyCode()
      Gets the ISO 4217 currency code of this currency.
      String getDisplayName(Locale aLocale)
      Gets the name that is suitable for displaying this currency for a specified locale.
      String getSymbol(Locale aLocale)
      Gets the symbol of this currency for a specified locale.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrencyCode

        String getCurrencyCode()
        Gets the ISO 4217 currency code of this currency.

        Currency codes are specified with a three-letter alphabetic code specified by ISO 4217

        Common currencies
        Currency name Currency code
        US Dollar USD
        Euro EUR
        Brittish Pound GBP
        Swedish Krona SEK
        Norwegian Krone NOK
        Returns:
        the ISO 4217 currency code of this currency.

      • getDisplayName

        String getDisplayName(Locale aLocale)
               throws NullPointerException
        Gets the name that is suitable for displaying this currency for a specified locale. If there is no suitable display name found for the specified locale, the ISO 4217 currency code is returned.
        Parameters:
        aLocale - the locale to use for display of this currency
        Returns:
        the display name of this currency for aLocale
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aLocale is null

      • getSymbol

        String getSymbol(Locale aLocale)
          throws NullPointerException
        Gets the symbol of this currency for a specified locale. For example, for the US Dollar, the symbol is "$" if the specified locale is the US, while for other locales it may be "US$". If no symbol can be determined, the ISO 4217 currency code is returned.
        Parameters:
        aLocale - the locale to use for display of the symbol of this currency
        Returns:
        the symbol of this currency for aLocale
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if aLocale is null

Sitevision - Portal and Content Management Made Easy
Sitevision is an advanced Java enterprise portal product and a portlet container (JSR 286) that implements Java Content Repository (JSR 283).
